channel.title: New problem?
channel.description:
Ok, This is my cache download atm.. http://dl.dropbox.com/u/49703817/pvpscapezcache.zip
I changed stuff in my cache so how would i make a new cache download thingy to go with my server.. Would i take the cache make it into a .rar file and go to megauploads and make it a link and that would be what i replace it with? or what Thanks. Also would they have to download it seperately or could i put it in the same folder somehow as the client.

item.title: New problem?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

HIGHK9:

New problem above thanks!

You update the cache, and you can either A) change the signlink(i think) to say there is a new version of the cache out when you release the new client. Or B) change the download link.
Keep it a .zip, that’s the only thing readable by private servers as of now.

Read full topic

item.title: New problem?
item.dc:creator: @HIGHK9 HIGHK9
item.description:
@HIGHK9 wrote:

New problem above thanks!

Read full topic

item.title: New problem?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“HIGHK9, post:3, topic:442423”]This is the compile thingy…

@echo off
Title Compiler
“C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.7.0_03\bin\javac.exe” *.java
pause

anything wrong with that?

This is the (x86)run info

@echo off
Title Client
cd ./
“C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe” -Xmx500m Gui 30 0 lowmem members 32
pause[/quote]
Try changing your run.cmd to jre7.
If you don’t have jre7 get it.

Read full topic

item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Update your JDK version in the compiler.
